private_information: I am responsible for a subset of moves in the execution sequence. I can pick up, unstack, stack and put down single blocks following standard BlocksWorld constraints.
robot1.goal: Provide a concise local description of the initial arrangement and the actions I executed. Do not emit PDDL. Provide any observations about ambiguities or local assumptions.

private_information: I am responsible for the complementary subset of moves in the execution sequence. I can pick up, unstack, stack and put down single blocks following standard BlocksWorld constraints.
robot2.goal: Provide a concise local description of the initial arrangement and the actions I executed. Do not emit PDDL. Provide any observations about ambiguities or local assumptions.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and must integrate their local observations into a single coherent model.
I must produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that encodes the initial state and the goal state implied by executing the full action sequence.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' reports, resolve any naming or perspective mismatches, derive the final blocks arrangement after the full action sequence, and provide a PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards that captures the initial state and the final state as the goal.

public_information: This is a standard BlocksWorld domain with the constraints that only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Blocks involved are A B C D E F G H I J K.
Initial arrangement summary: A on B, B on K, K on C, C on J, J on table, D on table, E on G, G on table, F on table, H on F, I on table.

The agents execute the following actions in order: 1 pickup(I), 2 stack(I,H), 3 unstack(A,B), 4 putdown(A), 5 unstack(I,H), 6 stack(I,D), 7 unstack(E,G), 8 stack(E,H), 9 unstack(I,D), 10 stack(I,E), 11 pickup(A), 12 stack(A,G), 13 unstack(I,E), 14 stack(I,D), 15 unstack(B,K), 16 stack(B,I), 17 unstack(B,I), 18 stack(B,E), 19 unstack(I,D), 20 stack(I,D), 21 unstack(I,D), 22 stack(I,D), 23 unstack(A,G), 24 stack(A,I), 25 pickup(G), 26 stack(G,K), 27 unstack(B,E), 28 stack(B,A), 29 unstack(E,H), 30 stack(E,G), 31 unstack(B,A), 32 stack(B,E), 33 unstack(A,I), 34 putdown(A), 35 unstack(H,F), 36 putdown(H), 37 unstack(I,D), 38 stack(I,F), 39 pickup(D), 40 stack(D,A), 41 unstack(D,A), 42 stack(D,A), 43 unstack(B,E), 44 putdown(B), 45 pickup(H), 46 stack(H,I), 47 unstack(E,G), 48 stack(E,B), 49 unstack(D,A), 50 stack(D,A).

Task: Using the initial arrangement and the action sequence derive the final arrangement of every block and produce a PDDL domain and problem that encodes the initial state and the final arrangement as the goal for FastDownwards.

local_observation.system_prompt: You are robot1. Provide a compact local report describing the initial stacks, the actions assigned to you from the global sequence, and any local assumptions. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on clarity and flag any inconsistencies.
local_observation.prompt: Your name is robot1. Use the environment public information and your private assignment of actions to summarize your local view. List the initial local stack relations you can observe and restate the moves you executed in order. Note any assumptions needed to interpret the global sequence.

local_observation.system_prompt: You are robot2. Provide a compact local report describing the initial stacks, the actions assigned to you from the global sequence, and any local assumptions. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on clarity and flag any inconsistencies.
local_observation.prompt: Your name is robot2. Use the environment public information and your private assignment of actions to summarize your local view. List the initial local stack relations you can observe and restate the moves you executed in order. Note any assumptions needed to interpret the global sequence.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent BlocksWorld planning and PDDL authoring targeting the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the agents' local reports into a single coherent initial state. Derive the final arrangement after applying the full action sequence. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that encode the BlocksWorld domain and that set the derived final arrangement as the goal. The PDDL must be compatible with FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions for different agents distinct if that is necessary for clarity.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the two agents local observations. Integrate them to reconstruct the global initial state and the exact sequence of actions. Compute the final arrangement of all blocks after executing the sequence. Then produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards that encodes the initial state and uses the final arrangement as the goal. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. Here are the agents reports: {state_robot1} {state_robot2} Use the environment public information as needed.
